trigger_condition: CVC rule triggered with no compliance justification provided
resolution_action: Freeze workflow → CVO committee review → Override with justification OR Terminate PR
example_scenario: PR for proprietary item >₹5L without MD approval and written justification as per CVC Rule 161

trigger_condition: Estimated PR value exceeds available budget by ≥20%
resolution_action: Budget reallocation OR PR rejection
example_scenario: PR for ₹10L when cost center has only ₹7L remaining budget (30% breach)

trigger_condition: Vendor blacklisted or debarred by CVC/Govt
resolution_action: Immediate PR termination + vendor alert flagged in system
example_scenario: Vendor flagged in CVC debarred list (corruption case) but buyer unaware, system auto-detects during classification

trigger_condition: SAP BAPI call fails after 3 retries (timeout/error)
resolution_action: Manual SAP sync OR Wait for SAP system recovery + Auto-retry
example_scenario: SAP system down for maintenance, PO creation fails. Manager manually syncs after SAP recovery

trigger_condition: Mandatory attachment missing (e.g. CVC Form 17 for single vendor)
resolution_action: Buyer uploads missing document OR Manager overrides with justification
example_scenario: Single vendor PR >₹50K missing CVC Form 17. Buyer notified, uploads form within 12 hours

trigger_condition: Vendor in HPCL internal blacklist (poor past performance)
resolution_action: Override with strong justification (e.g. only vendor for critical spare) OR Reject PR
example_scenario: Vendor blacklisted due to 3 consecutive late deliveries, but is sole supplier for proprietary spares. MD overrides for emergency procurement

trigger_condition: Vendor requests deadline extension due to force majeure (e.g. natural disaster)
resolution_action: Approve extension + Notify all bidders OR Reject extension request
example_scenario: Vendor requests 10-day extension due to floods disrupting manufacturing. Committee approves 7-day extension, notifies all 95 bidders

trigger_condition: Bid price >2 standard deviations above mean (suspiciously high)
resolution_action: Request vendor clarification OR Disqualify bid
example_scenario: Bid of ₹6.2L when mean is ₹4.3L (44% above). Committee requests price justification from vendor

trigger_condition: Bid price >2 standard deviations below mean (predatory pricing)
resolution_action: Request vendor cost breakdown OR Disqualify for anti-competitive pricing
example_scenario: Bid of ₹2.8L when mean is ₹4.3L (35% below). Committee suspects predatory pricing, requests detailed cost breakdown

trigger_condition: Email/SMS notification fails after 3 retries
resolution_action: Auto-retry with alternative channel (SMS if email fails) OR Log failure
example_scenario: Email notification to approver fails (mail server down). System auto-sends SMS notification within 5 min

trigger_condition: Non-mandatory field missing (e.g. PR remarks)
resolution_action: Skip field + Notify buyer to update later
example_scenario: Buyer forgets to fill 'Internal Reference Number' (optional field). System proceeds with PR, sends reminder to buyer

trigger_condition: ML classification confidence <0.7
resolution_action: Buyer manually selects category OR Manager reviews and corrects
example_scenario: ML classifies PR as 'IT Services' with 0.65 confidence (ambiguous description). Buyer manually corrects to 'IT Hardware'

trigger_condition: Assigned approver on leave with no delegate set
escalation_path: System → Delegate (if set) → Next level approver
resolution_action: Auto-assign to delegate OR Escalate to next level after 24h
example_scenario: Manager on leave, no delegate. System auto-escalates to CFO after 24 hours with notification

trigger_condition: Buyer submits duplicate PR (same vendor + value + description within 7 days)
resolution_action: Buyer confirms duplicate (merge) OR New PR (different purpose)
example_scenario: Buyer submits 2 PRs for 'Dell Laptops ₹2.5L' within 3 days. System flags, buyer confirms first PR was rejected, new PR is valid

trigger_condition: Vendor GST number invalid or not found in GSTN database
escalation_path: System → Buyer (update vendor GST) → Finance Manager
resolution_action: Buyer updates correct GST OR Finance Manager overrides for exempted entities (Govt/PSU)
example_scenario: Vendor GST '27AABCU9603R1Z9' returns 'Invalid' from GSTN API. System blocks PR, buyer corrects typo to '27AABCU9603R1Z5'

trigger_condition: Budget reserved by another PR in same cost center (parallel processing)
resolution_action: Queue PR until budget released OR Finance reallocates budget
example_scenario: 2 PRs submitted simultaneously for same cost center. First PR locks ₹5L budget, second PR queued. First PR completes, budget released, second PR auto-proceeds

trigger_condition: Tender published but zero bids received by deadline
resolution_action: Re-tender with relaxed terms OR Direct procurement with MD approval
example_scenario: Tender for niche software receives 0 bids (too restrictive specs). Committee relaxes specs, re-tenders with 21-day extension

trigger_condition: Vendor challenges evaluation scores (claims bias/error)
resolution_action: Committee reviews scores with audit trail + Justification OR Re-evaluation if error found
example_scenario: Vendor claims ML scoring error (wrong delivery time extracted via OCR). Committee verifies OCR, finds no error, provides detailed justification to vendor

trigger_condition: Vendor requests contract value increase >10% post-award
resolution_action: Approve amendment with justification OR Reject + Retender
example_scenario: Vendor requests 15% price increase due to raw material cost surge. CFO approves with market price verification + audit trail

trigger_condition: Buyer requests emergency PR (skip normal approvals due to urgency)
resolution_action: MD approves with post-facto committee review OR Reject if not genuine emergency
example_scenario: Plant shutdown imminent due to critical spare failure. Buyer creates emergency PR, MD approves within 2 hours, committee reviews compliance next day
